intro: Loncomelos pycnanthus, commonly known as the Mexican evergreen hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its evergreen foliage and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, preferring well-drained soil and partial to full sunlight. Due to its ornamental value, it is often cultivated in gardens and as a houseplant.
